alert.note: Alert for Atlantic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 27 at 3:46PM EDT until May 27 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL ATLANTIC...SOUTHWESTERN OCEAN AND SOUTHEASTERN BURLINGTON COUNTIES... At 346 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Batsto, or 18 miles northwest of Atlantic City, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Barnegat, Hammonton, Egg Harbor City, Tuckerton, Surf City, Port Republic, Wharton State Forest, Wading River, Brookville, Warren Grove, Bass River State Forest, Batsto, Chatsworth, Old Halfway, New Gretna, Penn State Forest, Beach Haven West, Pomona, Elwood-Magnolia and Mystic Island. This includes Garden State Parkway between mile markers 42 and 67. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
